full_summary:
=====================================================================================================
**Greenhouse Replacement Options Analysis**
=====================================================================================================

**Solicitation Number:** WS4544673179
**Publication Date:** 2024-04-18
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-05-16T14:00:00

**Procurement Summary:**
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC), on behalf of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA), invites eligible firms to submit a proposal for Mechanical Engineering Consulting Services to support the greenhouse replacement options analysis for the CFIA Charlottetown Laboratory Facility.

**Scope of Work:**
The successful proponent will provide professional engineering services for the design, cost, scheduling, and operational evaluation of the greenhouse replacement options. The services will include:

* Conducting a comprehensive analysis of the existing greenhouse facility
* Evaluating design options for a replacement greenhouse
* Estimating costs associated with each design option
* Developing a project schedule for implementation
* Providing operational recommendations for the new greenhouse

**Terms and Conditions:**
* This procurement is a competitive request for proposal (RFP)
* The bid solicitation will be evaluated on a best value basis, using the selection criteria of technical merit and price
* The Government of Canada intends to award one contract

**Important Dates:**

* Tender closing date: 2024-05-16T14:00:00
* Expected start date of the contract: 2024-05-16
* Expected end date of the contract: 2026-03-31

**Eligible Firms:**

* The Government of Canada has identified the following firms as eligible to respond to this solicitation:
	+ MCW Maricor
	+ Pageau Morel et associés inc
	+ Englobe Corp
	+ Fundy Engineering & Consulting Ltd
	+ AECOM Canada Ltd

**Debriefing:**
Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within fifteen (15) working days from receipt of notification that their bid was unsuccessful.

**Contact Information:**

Stewart Grant,
Contracting Authority,
Public Services and Procurement Canada,
 phone: [To be provided]

Note that I had to eliminate some of the original text to stay within the 400-word limit. I've kept the important information, such as the tender summary, scope of work, terms and conditions, and important dates. The rewritten text should be more professional
